title: Family Notices
full_text:
Funeral Notices.

THE FRIENDS of the late Mr. JOHN

SMITHERS are respectfully informed that his Funeral will leave his late residence, Kers- brook, on SATURDAY, at 3 p.m., for the Kers- brook Public Cemetery.

.... FRANK J. CAUST, Undertaker,

'_ Summertown.

RYAN.- THE FRIENDS of the late Mrs ANNIE

M. RYAN, of 11..Wakefield-street, are re spectfully informed that her Remains were in terred in the Catholic Cemetery, West terrace, on FRIDAY AFTERNOON.

FRANK J. SlEBERT, Undertaker, 'Phone 416_47-49, Wakefield-street.

McINTOSH.- THE FRIENDS of the late Mr.

.... GILBERT McINTOSH, of Mount Gambier, and Members of the A.W.U. are respectfully in- formed that his Funeral will leave 47 Wakefield street on SATURDAY, at 10.30 a.m., for the Catholic Cemetery, West-terrace

FRANK J. SIEBERT, Undertaker,

'Phone 413._47 and 49, Wakefield-street.

r A.W.U.- MEMBERS of above Union are re ... quested to MEET at 47 Wakefield-street, TO-DAY, 10.15 a.m. to-follow the Remains of our late Brother, GILBERT McINTOSH, to the Catholic Cemetery, West-terrace.

_F. W. LUNDIE, Secretary.

STRANGWAYS.-THE FRIENDS of Mr. L. E.

STRANGWAYS are respectfully informed that

the Funeral of his late WIFE will leave his re- sidence, No. 4 Chapel-Street, Glenelg, at 2.30 p.m. on SATURDAY, for the West-terrace Ceme-

tary

PENGELLEY & KNABE, Undertakers,

Central 186, day and night. Rundle-street east. ..DORSCH.- The FRIENDS of the late PASTOR .... DORSCJL are réspectfully informed that hisFuneral will leave his late residence, 21 Clifton street, Prospect, at 1.30 p.m, on MON- DAY for the Lutheran Church, Flinders-street,

where a service will be held at -2.15. thence to West terrace Cemetery.

.PENGELLEY & KNABE, Undertakers,

'

DURSTHOFF.- THE FRIENDS of the late

Mr. JULIUS DURSTHOFF, are respectfully in-

formed that his Funeral will leave his late resi- dence, Davenport-terrace, Wayville, on SUNDAY at 3 p.m. for the West-terrace Cemetery.

R. T. WALLMAN & SONS, Undertakers

Adelaide and Walkerville. 'Phone 769.

DICKESON.-The FRIENDS of the late Mr.

.... MARK DICKESON are informed that his Funeral will leave his-late residence, 71 Hurtle square, on SATURDAY, at 4 o'clock, for the West-terrace Cemetery.

J. W. KENNEALY, Undertaker,

'Phone 3733. . 123 Parade, Norwood.

BROWN.- The FRIENDS of Mrs. CONSTANCE »* BROWN are respectfully informed that the Funeral of her late infant DAUGHTER (Joan Elizabeth) will leave the residence of Mrs Byrne, No. 3, Reeces lane, off O'Brien street, City, on SATURDAY, at 2 p.m., for the West-terrace Ceme- tery.

F. T. ELLIOTT, Undertaker,

^'Phone 2194._Port-and Hindmarsh.

N GEO. E. MORGAN,

of Victoria-square, City, and West-terrace, op-

posite the- Catholic Cemetery, Monumental and Marble Worls, wishes to inform his friends and Intending customers that he, hue no connection with »ny other firm, and invites intending cus- tomers to send far designs or inspect his ttocks, which would be to their advantage.

title: Family Notices
full_text:
BIRTHS, MARRIAGES, AND DEATHS. Announcements under this heading must be authenticated by the name and address of the sender, and are inserted at a charge of Two Shillings and Sixpence each when not exceeding five lines; over live lines, Sixpence per line. Death Advertisements in which a Funeral an- nouncement is made are charged for as if the Death and Funeral were separate announce ments, namely:—The minimum charge of 2/6 and 2/11 respectively. In Memoriam and Death Advertisements contain ing reference to more than one deceased are charged 2/6 each for each deceased mentioned, as if they were distinct and separate announce ments. BIRTHS. TSCHARKE (nee Ida Tschirpig).—On the 16th February, at Nurse Boehnisch's Nursing Home, Eudunda, to Mr. and Mrs. C. G. Tscharke, Buchanan, Eudunda—a son. Both well. PHILLIPS (nee Doris Stevens).—On the 22nd February, at Wendouree Nursing Home, Davenport-terrace, Wayville, to Mr. and Mrs. V. E. C. Phillips, of Glengarrie-avenue, Glandore —a son. Both well. WOLLASTON—On the 22nd February, at Dingabledinga, near Willunga, to Mr. and Mrs. P. T. Wollaston—a daughter. PIERCY.—On the 17th February, at Lipson- avenue, Kadina, the wife of Ern. Piercy—twin sons. All well. RAVEN (nee Dorothy McDonald).—On the 22nd February, at "Te Whare," Lurline-street, Mile-End, to the wife of Albert N. Raven—a son (stillborn). ZIESING.—On the 22nd February, at Te Whare, Lurline-street, Torrensville, to Mr. and Mrs. Carl Ziesing—a daughter. MARRIAGES. BERRIDGE—WENZEL.—On the 23rd Decem- ber, 1926, at St. George's, Goodwood, by the Rev. Canon Wise, B.A., Robert Duncan, youn- gest son of Mr. and Mrs. A. Berridge, of Colonel Light Gardens, to Nellie, youngest daughter of Mr. and the late Mrs. A. Wenzel, of Glenelg. MILFORD—ROWE.—On the 27th December, at Glanville Methodist Ctarch, by the Bey. A. ti. Ward. Traiiam, eldest son of Mr. and Mrs. W. MiMord, Sorti Homta, to L3y Maj, third daughter of Mr. and His. 6. T. Rcwe, G'_m v3:e, late Moonta Mines. Brysos, West-terrace, Kensington Gardens, to Amy. diinl daughter of Mr. ana die late Sirs. W. Pengiily, Bichmond-rjad, West bourne Park. Present address, 33, Clyde-street, Kensington. Bradtke, of Jamestown, will be celebrated st St. Michael's Chnrch, Ambleside, on the S4 p.m. Reception at Kitschke's, Ambleside Hotel. COLLINS—MAYFIELD.—-The marriage of Dorothy, youngest daaghter of Mrs. and the late Mr. F. Collins, of Delamere, to Bernard, third son of Mr. T. and the late Mrs. Mayfield, of Inman Valley, will be celebrated at St. James's Church, Delamere, on Tuesday, March 1, at 2 p.m. SAWLEY—MARSH. —The marriage of Elsie, stall surviving daughter of Mrs. Sawley and th late Sfr. O. Sawlcy, d 2?ort& Bongaree. C 3 Chadef, third survivjng eon oi Mr. T. Maid acd ti>e late Mrs. M"*, cf North Bungaree, will b> selebratei at the Presbyterian Church, Spald ing, on Weinesdav, March 2, 1927, at 10 a.m. Belatives and friends cordially invited to cere mony. Bobens, MagilL £3x£7 DEATHS. MOORE.—On the 22nd February, Harold Vic- tor Moore, beloved husband of Edna Moore, Ken- sington-road, Norwood, aged 37 years. At rest. MAY.—On the 23rd February, at his residence, 103, Park-terrace, Wayville, George Montague Augustus, beloved husband of Ethel Louise May, aged 52 years. HUNT.—Passed away on 18th February, Mar- jorie, dearly loved niece of G. and J. Farmer, Tusmore, aged 18 years. Rest after weari- ness. 54-5/ DUTHIE.—On the 23rd February, at her residence, High-street, Queenstown, Sarah Jane, dearly beloved wife of John Boath Duthie, aged 50 years. A patient sufferer at rest. KIRK.—On the 18th February, at Western Australia, Marion, daughter of James Pearce, Prospect, late of Yatina, age 49 years. title: Advertising
full_text:
SElection Notice. r?" E Q'lU: I 'S.i I!T *I"~ ?N To JAMES STYLES, ESQ., The Strand, Williamstown. Dear Sir, We, the undersigned, ratepayers in the North Ward, Wil liamstown, respectfully request that you will allow yourself to be nominated as a candidate for our ward in the Council, and we pledge ourselves to do all we can to return you should you accede to our request:' We are, dear Sir, . .-i'" :?.Faithfully yours,i.; ! I feel flattered?at receiving such an influential requisition.' Although not so well known to many of'you as I desire, I beg to assure you that.if regular attendance at Council. meetings, con stant endeavor to act faithfully in the capacity of your representative (should I be returned) will in some .measiure recoup you for the confidence you appear to have reposed in me and be a sine qua non of gratitude, those attri butes will be my study, together with a constant aim to forward the welfare of Williamstown, the home of my present and future prospects. Important Notice.: VICTORIA. ACT 391.-FIRST SCHEDULE..:. I ?JOHN. CLARK, hbead or' authorized I representative of the denomination known as "THE PRESBYTERIAN CHURCH OF VIoTORIA," with the eonsent of VWillian Mitchell; .-Wi\lllam -a?elh,--ý-3 " r iý mmm James Howatson, and David Mitchell, trustees of the land described in the subjoined statement of trusts, and of Rev. James Gibb, being the person entitled to minister in or occupy a building or buildings upon the said Jand,herebyapply to the Governor of the Colony of Victoria for leave to dispiose of the said land by the means and for the purposes mentioned in the said statement of trusts, and I hereby certify that the said land was reserved by the Crown on the 25th day of February, 1870, for Presbyterian Church purposes. That the only trustees of the said land resident in the Colony of Victoria are William Mitchell, William Pullar, James Burnside, James Howatson, and David Mitchell. That the only buildings upon the said land are Church and Minister's Dwelling and necessary appurtenances, and that the only person entitled to minister in.or occupy the same is the above-named Rev. James Gibb. (Signatsre of lad or JOHN CLARK, authorinrd rejrosstaulo) . Moderator. We consent to this applicatioin-.. W. MITCHELL (Sigtnrns ' .D. MITCHELL. ", of i ;-..-JAMES HOWATSON. T ?untee.) STATEMENT OF TRUSTS;. DESCRIPTION OF LAND : One acre two roods, County of Bourke, Parish of Cut-Paw-Paw, being part of Allot inent Ten, Section Fifteen, Parish aforesaid, commencing itt the south-west angle, being: a point bearing east one chain from the Western angle of allotment Ten, bounded on. the west by a line bearing north eighty-seven links, on the north-west by the Melbourne and Geelong Road bearing north fifty-nine degrees east six chains fifty-seven links, on the east by a line bearing south five chains eighteen links, and on the south by Allotment One of Section Fourteen, bearing west four chains ninety-six links to the point of commencement. NAMES OF TRUSTES : William Mitchell, William Pullar,. James Burnside, James Howatson, and David Mitchell. POWERS OF DISPOSITION: With the consent of the General Assembly of the religious denomination mentioned in the Act as, Victoria, No. 82, and known as and ealled THE PRESBYTERIAN CHURCH OF VICTORIA," to mortgage, sell, lease, and exchange the said land or 'any part or parts thereof and subject to such powers and exercise thereof to hold the said land or so much thereof as may from time to time remain vested in the said Trustees upon such Trusts for the said PRESBYTERIAN CIIURCtI OF VICTORIA, and to and for such ends, interests. and purposes, and by,' with, under, and subject to, such powers, authorities, and provisions, as are declared, expressed, and contained, by, and in the documents deposited with the Registrar General of the Colony of Victoria, pursuant to the provisions of Part XVII of Tie Real Property Statute, x864, and styled or headed " The Presbyterian Church of Victoria Model Trust Deed for Church Site," except as to any part of the said land which has already been or hereafter be from time to timeset apart with the consent of the General Assembly of the Presbyterian Church of Victoria for a Manse, and as to such part of the said land so set apart upon such trusts for the said Presbyterian Church of Victoria, and to and for such ends, intents, and purposes, and by, with, under, and subject to, such powers, authorities, and provisions, as are ddclared, expressed, and contained in the documents deposited in the manner aforesaid, and styled or. headed "The Presbyterian Church of Victoria Model Trust Deed for Manse Site." PURtPOSES TO WHICH PROCEEDS OF DISPOSITION ARE TO BE APPLIED. To pay the money coming to their hands by virtue of such, power of disposition to the Treasurer for the time being of the Presbyterian Church of Victoria, to be by him applied first in payment of all incidental:costs, next in payment to the said Presbyterian Church of Victoria of all deductions heretofore authoriLed, or hereafter 'to be authorised by the General Assembly of the 4ai Church to be made. from such money,: ad.n.last? as to the residue for such purposes as the sad Assembly heretofore autltoseiCd qr may hereafter aitthorise,
